content: What is the "pr" comparison operator in the _filter search language an acronym for? And what are its operands supposed to be? The description says it checks whether a set is empty or not - that sounds like a unary operator?
pr checks to see whether elements are present. It's a unary operator. The left-hand operand would be an expression that evaluates to a collection of matches.
"pr" = "present". From oData operator with the same code
OK, thanks. Then I assume the right-hand operand is just for comparing with the evaluated unary operator. So (X pr true) is (pr X) and (X pr false) is (not (pr X))
